sense.name: a contestant, one who competes to win
sense.commentary: OPPONENT[+entity][+person][+contestant] Note: implies a game with a winner and loser
sense.examples: After winning the first round, we faced a much tougher opponent in the second round. A computer proved to be a worthy opponent to the world chess champion. The congressman beat his opponents by a landslide.

sense.name: one who disagrees, objects to
sense.commentary: OPPONENT[+entity][+person][+disputant] Note: does not imply a game or competition, just a general disagreement
sense.examples: He is an outspoken opponent of socialist economic policies. There are few opponents to this bill in the House. Bob seemed to be an opponent to every one of Mary's proposals to the committee.

sense.name: a muscle that counteracts another muscle
sense.examples: Which muscle is the opponent of the triceps?
